subject: Using Junit 3.7 with Objectivity for Java
msgSnippet: Has anyone tried using JUnit with Objectivity/Java? I ve reproduced this on Objy versions 6.0 and 6.1. I m getting a strange ClassCastException from deep in
messageBody:
Has anyone tried using JUnit with Objectivity/Java? I've reproduced
this on Objy versions 6.0 and 6.1.

I'm getting a strange "ClassCastException" from deep in the
implementation code of Objectivity, when I try to do a

ooDBObj.getDefaultContainer();

It works fine when I run the same code outside the JUnit test case,
but from inside, it behaves differently. It seems as if there is some
kind of clash between the two libraries. Anyone have any ideas?
